properties.areaDesc: West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 5 at 5:03AM MST until February 5 at 8:00AM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TO IMPACT THE SACRAMENTO MOUNTAINS, THE EASTERN
LOWLANDS OF OTERO COUNTY, EL PASO AND HUDSPETH COUNTY...

.Snow continues to fall across the advisory area. Snow should
taper off as the morning progresses. A snow shower or flurries
will be possible this afternoon, but most precipitation should end
by then.

* WHAT...Snow. Up to 2 inches of snow has already fallen today.
1-2 additional inches possible.

* SNOW AMOUNTS...Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches.

* WHEN...Until 8 AM MST Wednesday.

* WHERE...West slopes of the Sacramento Mountains.

* TIMING...Most of the snowfall will end this morning.

* IMPACTS...Snowfall will create slick roads and reduce
visibility making for hazardous travel conditions.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST THIS MORNING
